title: Business Live: Tech stocks fall - BBC News
summary: middle-income home ownership for 25 to 34-year-olds sinks .
iod calls for partial customs union .

documents.title: good night
text: thank you for following business live this week .
we hope you have a great weekend and look forward to you joining us once again on monday morning from 6.00am .

documents.title: subdued close for us markets
text: the dow jones industrial average ends the week with a whimper , up 16.32 points at 25,216.69 .
the s & p 500 is ahead 1.03 points at 2,732.23 .
the nasdaq has finished 16.96 points lower at 7,239.47 .
facebook is off 1.44 % at $ 177.36 while twitter 's share price has closed down 1.69 % at $ 33.06 .

documents.title: where now for equities ?
text: as we come to the end of a much less rocky week for us stocks , what are investors expecting in the sort-term for equities ?
ben phillips , chief investment officer of eventshares , says : `` the fundamental story has not changed .
`` we really have not seen the tax reform start flowing through yet into company earnings .
we think it 's going to cause a second wave of earnings optimism . ''

while rick meckler , president of investment firm libertyview capital management , says : `` there are certainly parts of the market that are not hurt by higher [ interest ] rates and i imagine those stocks to move along .
`` particularly , technology stocks that not only do n't have exposure to interest rates but have cash balances . ''

documents.title: tech tent : two sides of the crypto-coin
text: is the whole reputation of the crypto-currency industry under threat as computers are hijacked to mine new coins ?
on the tech tent podcast this week , we ask whether a new breed of environmentally conscious blockchain entrepreneurs can demonstrate that this technology does have a sustainable future .
read more here .
author: Rory-Cellan Jones
Technology correspondent

documents.title: us fed seeks to fine and ban former barclays banker
text: federal reserve board seeking to impose a $ 487,500 fine on former barclays bank plc employee and permanently bar him from the banking industry :
ok
was the damage assessed as being greater than the fines imposed by @ twitterid corrupt trading activities ?
because if not , of course they will ( as they have ) continue to hurt citizens for their own greedy gains .
tough , necessary

documents.title: facebook told to stop tracking in belgium
text: facebook has been ordered to stop tracking people without consent , by a court in belgium .
the company has been told to delete all the data it had gathered on people who did not use facebook .
the court ruled the data was gathered illegally .
belgium 's privacy watchdog said the website had broken privacy laws by placing tracking code - known as cookies - on third-party websites .
facebook said it would appeal against the ruling .
read the full story here .

documents.title: us stock markets unsettled
text: us stocks are bouncing around on friday .
the nasdaq is back in negative territory , down 5.04 points at 7,251.39 .
the dow jones industrial is now up 55.77 points at 5,256.14 after briefly rising by 200 points earlier .
the s & p 500 is up 4.68 points at 2,736.10 .

documents.title: still crazy ?
text: it was n't that long ago that mark zuckerberg , co-founder and chief executive of facebook , which owns instagram , dismissed suggestions that false news stories on the social networking site could have impacted the 2016 presidential election .

documents.title: social media giants already grilled on 'fake news '
text: in late 2017 , lawyers for facebook , twitter and google were questioned by the us senate intelligence committee about possible russian interference in the 2016 election and the use of automated bots on their platforms to spread divisive information .
facebook said as many as 126 million american users may have seen content uploaded by russia-based operatives over the past two years .
the social networking site said about 80,000 posts were produced before and after the 2016 presidential election .

documents.title: russians 'posed as real us persons to post on social media '
text: the indictment against 13 russians and three companies for interfering in the us 2016 election says : `` defendants , posing as us persons and creating false us personas , operated social media pages and groups designed to attract us audiences .
`` these groups and pages , which addressed divisive us political and social issues , falsely claimed to be controlled by us activists when , in fact , they were controlled by defendants .
`` defendants also used the stolen identities of real us persons to post on organisation-controlled social media accounts .

`` over time , these social media accounts became defendants ' means to reach significant numbers of americans for purposes of interfering with the us political system , including the presidential election of 2016 . ''

documents.title: 'russians conducted information warfare '
text: 'russians conducted information warfare '

documents.title: facebook and twitter shares fall
text: shares in facebook are down 1.02 % at $ 178.12 and twitter is off 1.37 % at $ 33.15 .

it follows the publication of an indictment that a russian internet agency and more than a dozen russians interfered in the us election campaign between 2014 and 2016 in a multi-pronged effort including though social media .
read the full story here .

documents.title: has the city found an answer to the brexit question ?
text: the us matters more than europe .
keeping up with the us is more important than keeping in with the eu .
amidst the flurry of ideas about how to keep the links between europe and its financial hub , london , intact after brexit , a calm resolve is emerging among finance chiefs in london .
keeping london competitive with new york is job number one .
everything else is of secondary importance .
read more here .
author: Simon Jack
BBC Business Editor

documents.title: oil prices rise despite higher rig count
text: after volatile trading on thursday , oil prices are heading upwards .
brent crude is up 0.8 % at $ 64.87 a barrel while west texas intermediate is ahead 0.6 % at $ 61.53 .
prices rose despite an increase in the number oil rigs that us energy companies added over last week .
drillers added seven oil rigs in the week to 16 february , taking the total count up to 798 - the highest since april 2015 , according the energy services company baker hughes .

documents.title: merkel 'curious ' about uk 's brexit aims
text: merkel 'curious ' about uk 's brexit aims

documents.title: diamond geezer : who is nirav modi ?
text: indian billionaire nirav modi ( above with actress naomi watts ) made his fortune from diamond trading and jewellery .
but this week he was named in a investigation into an alleged $ 1.8bn fraud at a state-run bank .
who is he ?
we 've been taking a look at his connections to hollywood , bollywood and the inner circles of indian politics .
author: Simon Atkinson
Asia Business Reporter

documents.title: fresh brexit talks on northern ireland
text: fresh brexit talks on northern ireland
author: John Campbell
BBC News NI Economics & Business Editor

documents.title: gap widens for homeownershipthe institute for fiscal studies tweets
text: young adults in all regions face house-price-to-income ratios significantly higher than 20 years ago @ twitterid
how do the repayments to income ratios compare ?

documents.title: us may single out countries for steel tariffs
text: the us commerce department has recommended a 24 % tariff on global steel imports from all countries .
it has also presented another option to levy a 53 % import charge for certain countries including china , vietnam , brazil and south korea .

documents.title: fiat chrysler recalls trucks
text: fiat chrysler has announced that it will recall 228,508 trucks in the us , canada , mexico and some other markets because driver could accidentally shift their vehicles out of `` park '' .
it said it was not aware of any injuries related to the issue .

documents.title: us 'proposes 7.7 % tariff on aluminium imports '
text: reports are emerging that the us commerce department is recommending a 7.7 % tariff on aluminium imports .
us president donald trump has signaled that he would be prepared to take some action to restrict imports of steel and aluminum into north america .
he said : `` what we 're talking about is tariffs and or quotas .
`` part of the options would be tariffs coming in .
as they dump steel , they pay tariffs , substantial tariffs , which means the united states would actually make a lot of money . ''

documents.title: london shares close up
text: the ftse 100 has finished up 59.89 points at 7,294.70 .
the ftse 250 is ahead 158.88 points at close to 19,733.64 .

documents.title: us stocks extend gains
text: the dow jones industrial average has eked out further rises and is now up 131.44 points at 25,331.81 .
the s & p 500 has added 12.20 points at 2,743.40 and the nasdaq is ahead 22.58 points at 7,279.14 .

documents.title: goodbye from jeffrey ?
text: sky news is reporting that struggling retailer toys r us has to find £ 15m to pay a tax bill .
it says that advisers are working to secure a rescue deal ahead of a 27 february deadline for the vat payment .
in a rescue plan struck last year , toys r us said it would close 26 of its 105 uk stores .
retail analyst steve dresser has been at one of the shops that is shutting :
stumbled upon a closing toys r us .
given today 's news we 'll see more of this .
is it any wonder though ?
somehow their stores completely lack any magic and mystery .
sanitised , soulless stores full of product piled high .
maybe you will # toysrus

documents.title: royal mint appoints first female boss in 1,100 years
text: never let it be said that the royal mint does n't move with the times .
it has appointed anne jessopp as its new chief executive - the first woman to lead the organisation in 1,100 years .
ms jessopp , who is also deputy master of the mint , said : `` i am delighted to be appointed to lead this unique and important british organisation .
the royal mint has an impressive history of over 1,100 years and its longevity is due to its ability to adapt as society changes . ''
it may have taken over 1,000 years but the mint is now finally led by a woman , and i am certain anne will do a great job . ''

documents.title: fca hands over rbs restructuring group reportbbc business journalist joe lynam tweets
text: @ nickymorgan01 in response to @ twitterid handing over the full s166 report : the committee will meet when parliament returns on tuesday .
at that meeting , i will be asking members to agree to publish the final , unredacted report under parliamentary privilege as soon as possible . ''
joe , here 's our take on whether criticisms of fca reasonable and fair in relation to rbs grg , answer no see commentary at this link

documents.title: us shares recover
text: the dow jones industrial average has turned around a shaky start to trading and is now up 106.61 points at 25,306.98 .
the s & p 500 has also recovered and is 8.93 points ahead at 2,740.13 .
the nasdaq is ahead 26.45 points at 7,282.88 .

documents.title: citigroup boss lands 48 % pay rise
text: the boss of us investment bank citigroup has been handed a 48 % pay rise .
michael corbat , who has been the boss of citigroup since 2012 , will take home $ 23m for 2017 .
over last year , citigroup 's share price rose by 25 % and its profit grew by 4 % .

documents.title: london stocks on the up
text: the ftse 100 is heading towards the end of the week on a positive note .
the index of blue chip stocks has added 45.12 points to 7,279.93 .
shares in property manager segro is leading the risers , up 6.1 % at 589.40p after announcing strong full-year results .
mining group randgold resources is the biggest faller on friday , with its shares down 2.2 % at £ 63.02 .
the ftse 120 is up 148.31 points at 19,723.07 .

documents.title: housing starts soar in the us
text: housing construction in the us soared by 9.7 % in january according to the commerce department .
it said that builders broke ground on 1.326 million units , the highest annual rate since october 2016 .
building permits rose by 7.4 % to a rate of 1.396 million units in january , the highest since june 2007 .

documents.title: breakingus markets open down
text: the dow jones industrial average has opened 41.61 points lower at 25,158.76 .
the s & p 500 is off 3.20 points at 2,728 and the nasdaq is down 12.07 points at 7,244.36 .

documents.title: no dice now but qualcomm is open to talks
text: broadcom 's $ 121bn bid for us chip-maker qualcomm still is n't good enough but the two had `` constructive '' talks .

in an update to its shareholders , qualcomm 's chairman paul jacobs said : `` the board remains unanimously of the view that this proposal materially undervalues qualcomm and has an unacceptably high level of risk , and therefore is not in the best interests of qualcomm stockholders . ''

mr jacobs added : `` our board is open to further discussions with broadcom to see if a proposal that appropriately reflects the true value of qualcomm shares , and ensures an appropriate level of deal certainty , can be obtained . ''

documents.title: kraft heinz performance 'did not reflect potential '
text: following a disappointing year for sales , it is perhaps just as well that kraft heinz and brazilian private equity firm 3g did not succeed in their £ 115bn approach for anglo-dutch consumer goods giant unilever .

commenting on the company 's results , bernardo hees , chief executive of kraft heinz , said : there 's no question that our financial performance in 2017 did not reflect our progress or potential . ''

however , he said that kraft heinz had accelerated some `` important business investments '' and said that further spending as well as the recent us corporate tax cut `` should help further advantage our brands and grow our business in 2018 and beyond '' .

documents.title: google appeases getty images over copyright infringement
text: google has made it more difficult for people to save from its image search product , as part of a `` peace deal '' with photo library getty images .
in 2017 , getty images complained to the european commission , accusing google of anti-competitive practices .
getty images said that google 's image search made it easy for people to find getty images and take them , without the appropriate permission or licence .

documents.title: ( not ) on the buses
text: transport correspondent victoria fritz tweets :
britain 's bus coverage is now at a 28 year low .
@ twitterid `` we live in a society that is quite prepared to completely abandon certain groups of people and leave them with no options of getting around . ''
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid

documents.title: kraft sales drop as taste for cheese falters
text: kraft heinz has reported disappointing sales figures over the christmas trading period .
revenue in the us fell by 1.1 % to $ 4.79bn , declining for the seventh straight quarter due to a decreasing demand from american retailers for processed foods such as cheese .
over the fourth quarter to december 30 , total sales edged up to $ 6.9bn but over the full year fell to $ 26.2bn from $ 26.4bn .
kraft heinz said there had been `` lower shipments across several categories , particularly nuts , natural cheese and cold cuts in the us well as cheese and coffee in canada '' .

documents.title: edf profits slide
text: edf 's profits in the uk have fallen by a third despite raising gas and electricity prices last year by 5.5 % and 9 % respectively .
the french energy company said that underlying uk profits fell €700m to €1bn for 2017 , while sales slipped 0.8 % to €8.6bn .
edf said that warmer weather and rising energy efficiency led to a 1.9 % fall in electrical consumption and a 2.6 % dip in use of natural gas .
sales were also affected by the weaker sterling , which had an `` unfavourable impact '' of €608m .
overall , edf 's like-for-like sales were down 2.2 % to €69bn , while underlying profits fell 16.3 % to €13.7bn .

documents.title: coca-cola hit by tax charge
text: quarterly revenues at coca-cola have sunk by a fifth as the drinks maker continues to sell off its bottling operations , while the drink company also took a $ 3.6bn charge on new tax laws .
that helped push the fanta and sprite maker to a $ 2.75bn net loss in the three months to december .
the company reported a profit of $ 550m for the same period in 2016 .
operating revenue fell about $ 2bn to $ 7.5bn , mainly due to the refranchising of its bottling operations , and slightly better than analysts ' estimates .

documents.title: uber to report crimes directly to police
text: uber is reporting crimes directly to the police and will set up a phone line as part of measures to improve safety .
last year , a metropolitan police officer said in a letter that passengers were being put at risk because of delays in the reporting of sexual assaults .
the ride hailing firm said it was changing its policy `` after listening to feedback '' .
it is appealing against transport for london 's decision to withdraw its operating licence in the capital .
read more here .

documents.title: linde/praxair merger under scrutiny
text: breaking news from the exciting world of industrial gases ( yes we know you 've been holding your breath ) : the european commission has opened an in-depth investigation into the proposed $ 85bn merger of linde and praxair .
the commission says the merger could reduce competition for some crucial gases .
`` gases - like oxygen and helium - are crucial inputs for a large variety of products we use every day , '' said competition commissioner margrethe vestager .
`` we will carefully assess whether the proposed merger between praxair and linde would lead to higher prices or less choice for european consumers and businesses . ''

documents.title: jack ma stars in his own movie
text: speaking of alibaba , the ecommerce giant 's idiosyncratic chief executive , jack ma , has outdone his recent impersonation of michael jackson by starring in his own movie .
alibaba has released gong shou dao - a 20-minute chinese martial arts film - globally online today on youtube and several chinese streaming sites .
mr ma stars as the main protagonist - a kung fu master who duels with various martial arts masters from around the world .

the film features famous chinese actors jet li , donnie yen and wu jing , plus sammo hung and the choreographers behind crouching tiger , hidden dragon - all of whom volunteered their time for free , alibaba claims .

documents.title: the 'red envelope ' strategy
text: it 's chinese new year today and china 's biggest ecommerce companies , tencent and alibaba , have been holding promotions to drive up mobile payments .

it is traditional for children to be given `` lucky '' red packets of money by their families on the first day of the lunar new year , and alibaba and tencent have been encouraging people to send `` virtual red envelopes '' using their smartphone apps .
users are offered 1 billion yuan worth of cash prizes and shopping coupons as rewards for using the apps instead of cash , and lots of big chinese brands sign up to be sponsors .
mobile payments have caught on incredibly quickly in china , where users made $ 5.5 trillion worth of mobile payment transactions in 2016 , according to internet consultants iresearch .
marketing expert colin lewis thinks that western brands need to take notes .
`` the regulation and cultural landscape in the uk is totally different to china , and there is lots of pre-existing competition , '' he writes in marketing week .

`` maybe it wo n't be red envelopes , but it 's hard not to imagine a new payment mechanism that combines gamification , gifting and social that takes advantage of our existing habits to exponentially grow the mobile payments market .
whichever brand can do that will have the bankers going red in the face . ''

documents.title: food for thought
text: samuel tombs at pantheon macroeconomics also thinks the uk economy will remain sluggish this year .
falling food sales to blame for january 's below-consensus uk retail sales .
the good news is that supermarkets have largely finished hiking prices due to the weak £ .
but rising mortgage rates and an intensifying fiscal squeeze suggest sales growth will remain sluggish this year
perhaps everyone is more keen to get into shape than usual given that sports equipment sales were stronger .
they 'll probably give up in 3 weeks time and will start buying more food again lol !
( although given the data is lagged they probably already have )

documents.title: danone profits jump
text: danone has reported strong sales due to strong growth in its waters and specialised nutrition divisions .
the french food group 's like-for-like sales in 2017 rose 2.5 % to €24.7bn , slightly better than expectations but slower than the 2.9 % posted the previous year .
net profit jumped €740m to €2.56bn .

the food group said strong demand for evian and its other waters led to sales growth of more than 10 % in the second half of the year , while baby formula performed particularly well in china during the fourth quarter , thanks to consumers ' distrust of domestic milk powder brands .
in europe sales of alpro , the plant and nut dairy alternative brand , rose almost 10 % in the fourth quarter following rising popularity in the uk , germany , belgium and the netherlands .

documents.title: retailers 'under intense pressure '
text: richard lim , chief executive of retail economics , says january 's retail figures are the worst since 2013 due to higher inflation .
`` inflation has proved stickier than expected , remaining at uncomfortably high levels for many households .
as spending on essentials eats into personal finances , consumers have continued to cut back on discretionary spending elsewhere , '' he says .
the cost environment facing retailers is fiercely hostile .
they face spiralling operating costs with increases in business rates , national living wage and property all in the pipeline .
against a backdrop of soft consumer demand and shifting consumer behaviour towards online and the experience economy , we expect many retailers are under intense pressure . ''

documents.title: fears over economy
text: ey item club economist howard archer wonders if today 's weak retail sales figures point to a slowing economy :
following softer set of january purchasing managers ' surveys for # services , # manufacturing & # construction , muted # retail # sales fuels sus # uk # economy may have slowed at start of 2018 .
we currently see q1 # gdp # growth at 0.4 % q/q in q1 after 0.55 q/q expansion in q4 2017
thanks for this howard .
its not info i come across in my day to day life so really useful .
no scare mongering now .
here in holland food sales are also down in january but the economy is not slowing down .
probably due to the fact that more people are eating out ! !
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid # weloveeurope
or , everyone has had an expensive festive season , their bellies are full and are on a diet

documents.title: kuroda gets another five years
text: lunar new year holidays meant most markets across asia were closed on friday ( even if your hard-working asia business team were at their desks as usual , fuelled by a basket load of 'lucky ' tangerines and a tub of fish-skin crisps ) .

however , markets were open in japan , where the nikkei 225 added 1.2 % to close at 21,720.3 points , driven by news the country 's central bank was reappointing haruhiko kuroda for another term as governor .
giving him another five-year term is seen as a signal that premier shinzo abe 's sees kuroda as the right person to stimulate the country 's economy .
the decision to make masazumi wakatabe one of his deputies also cheered investors - he is see as an advocate of bolder monetary easing .
author: Simon Atkinson
Asia Business Reporter

documents.title: is ghosn still in charge of renault ?
text: more from the ft 's peter campbell , who has been listening to the renault conference call this morning :
first journalist 's question to carlos ghosn is why he accepted a 30 per cent pay cut as renault ceo .
a : `` my job has changed '' .
says he is not running the company day to day .
so when is a ceo not a ceo ?
does ghosn staying mean renault is the weaker partner in the alliance ?
ghosn says not his decision to appoint him .
at nissan he proposed handing over to saikawa , says in renault he was asked & insisted that he had a strong number two .
( sounds like he was pushed to stay . )
5 journalist questions so far .
2 on pay , 3 on alliance/ghosn tenure .
succession/management remains way more important than record results .
important clarification from ghosn on new management structure .
cfo and hr both report to ( newly created ) coo .
so bollore looks like ceo in everything but name .
first journalist 's question to carlos ghosn is why he accepted a 30 per cent pay cut as renault ceo .
a : `` my job has changed '' .
says he is not running the company day to day .
so when is a ceo not a ceo ?
does ghosn staying mean renault is the weaker partner in the alliance ?
ghosn says not his decision to appoint him .
at nissan he proposed handing over to saikawa , says in renault he was asked & insisted that he had a strong number two .
( sounds like he was pushed to stay . )
5 journalist questions so far .
2 on pay , 3 on alliance/ghosn tenure .
succession/management remains way more important than record results .
important clarification from ghosn on new management structure .
cfo and hr both report to ( newly created ) coo .
so bollore looks like ceo in everything but name .

documents.title: retail slows down
text: food sales in january fell 0.9 % in volume terms compared with the same month in 2016 - their biggest fall since october .
the office for national statistice said unusually strong january growth in sales of sporting equipment , including gym wear , was `` offset by falling food sales '' .
retail sales volumes fell sharply in december as shoppers brought forward their christmas spending into november to take advantage of black friday sales promotions .

but for the three months to january , which smooths out monthly volatility , sales inched up just 0.1 % after a rise of 0.5 % in the three months to december - the weakest three-month period since april 2017 .
`` retail sales growth was broadly flat at the beginning of the new year with the longer-term showing a continued slowdown in the sector , '' ons statistician rhian murphy said .
`` this can partly be attributed to a background of generally rising prices . ''

documents.title: breakingretail sales struggle
text: retail sales barely rose in january , suggesting consumer demand remained lacklustre at the start of the year .
sales volumes rose 0.1 % compared with december , and lower than an expected jump of 0.5 % .

documents.title: us rejects stock exchange buy
text: a us regulator has rejected a proposed merger between the privately-owned chicago stock exchange ( chx ) and a chinese-led investor group .
the chx , which accounts for just 0.5 % of stock trades in the us , first proposed the tie-up with the chinese-led north america casin group in 2016 .
the deal would have provided chx with `` vital capital '' , the exchange said .
the merger was initially approved by the committee on foreign investment in the united states , pending approval by the securities and exchange commission ( sec ) .
but several politicians , including president trump , have said letting a chinese-affiliated firm buy a us exchange was a bad idea .
yesterday , after a prolonged review process , the sec said finally that the deal did not meet the rules that govern us stock exchanges .

documents.title: at the bottom
text: ifs director paul johnson has tweeted this handy chart on the slide in home ownership for middle income 25 to 34-year-olds .
home ownership rates among middle income young people have collapsed in last 20 years .
middle earners used to be like high earners in housing tenure .
now they look , perhaps feel , more like those at the bottom of the income distribution
interesting graph , but it just goes to show the mindset in this country that home ownership is the panacea .
it 's not .
the rest of the world copes just fine with much less home ownership and more renting .
it 's a naive british mentality that home ownership is for all .
most of those countries do n't have a section 21
true and a point well made , however , the underlying issue of people thinking the only way to live is ownership is simply wrong .
the system does need to be more in favour of tenants , agreed , but renting is not the evil here , per se .
i agree , but it 's a redundant point .
most people desire secure living accommodations and the only way that 's currently possible in this country is via being an owner occupier .
there 's nothing naive about it .
sadly you miss my point .
the rest of europe cope quite well where the system supports renting .
the uk system does n't at the moment , but the point remains , home ownership is not for all .
it 's that mindset that is naive .
i 'm not missing it , it 's a common point and one i agree with in general .
it 's just that 'systems ' are only relevant in their own context .
it 's not naive to have an ambition in your own socio-legal context .
we 'll have to agree to disagree on that small point at the end .
all the best !

this is a frightening graph paul , much as it grieves me to say so we need the massive property price bubble to burst if home ownership can perpetuate throughout this century as an aspiration for every man and woman in the uk .
what we have now as a market is not sustainable .
two things will reduce house prices .
much higher interest rates which will be painful for many ; or build many more new homes .
what about higher taxation ?
the first moves are starting to bite
wonder how different this looks if you strip the south east and london out
good point , you can buy a substantial house in the north of england for 300k anybody on 25-32k should be able to save the deposit needed with very little sacrifice
rubbish
we all lost half our spending power in the decade running up to the financial crisis .
it was an entirely new labour phenomenon .
yes .
ironic that middle earners generally precluded from accessing `` social housing '' because they earn too much .
so much for hard work ?
thanks for using last 20 yrs '' .
other seem fixated on since 2006 '' .
2006 meant nothing in the scheme of things .
it 's also striking that nearly 2 out of every 5 of the richest households are not homeowners - at this rate even the top quintile will be majority renters .
a sign of a very sick market
most of the richest households will be based in the south east - where the higher incomes are still nowhere near what is needed to buy a tiny flat .
yes they are .

documents.title: no more power rangers toys
text: japanese toymaker bandai has ended its partnership with saban brands to produce power rangers toys after 25 years .
it may surprise you to know that toys from the mighty morphin children 's tv show have been made consistently from the 1990s - but production will stop at the end of 2018 .
the latest incarnation of the power rangers can be watched in the super ninja steel series , and bandai is producing limited collectors ' edition 25th anniversary toys .
power rangers is still shown on us tv and remains one of the highest-rated and longest-running live-action series for kids .

documents.title: drivers shun diesel
text: peter campbell , motor industries correspondent at the financial times , tweetsl
wow .
ghosn says diesel demand in europe among retail ( ie consumers rather than fleet ) is falling faster than the data shows , because the industry is slow to respond to the shift to petrol .
says customer requests for petrol `` much bigger '' than sales indicate .
with germans today discussing to refit diesel cars with tax payers money making your car a frankenstein diesel car which could break at any moment i can imagine that nobody wants diesel .

documents.title: is the iod 's plan viable ?
text: as mentioned earlier , the institute of directors ( iod ) has suggested that the uk follow a brexit trade plan that features a partial customs union to govern industrial goods and processed agricultural products .
but is this plan viable ?
bbc economics correspondent andrew walker has his doubts .
`` the trouble is that under world trade organisation ( wto ) rules , these free trade agreements are supposed to cover 'substantially all the trade ' , '' he says .
`` there is no authoritative definition of that term , but leaving out all industrial and processed agricultural goods surely would n't qualify .

`` i suppose you might try it on - that is have a third country deal and hope no other wto member would challenge a trade agreement that left out industrial goods etc - although it would be a strange thing to do if you were trying to take some sort of wto leadership role . ''

documents.title: dig up a road , pay a fine
text: councils can start fining utility firms that dig up roads and cause traffic congestion , the department of transport said .
firms will have to `` rent '' lanes on roads and pay up to £ 2,500 for a day 's roadworks on the busiest streets during peak travel times .
pilots conducted in london and kent since 2015 led to a reduction in traffic jams as firms were incentivised to work on quieter roads or avoid rush hour .
it was also noticed that firms began collaborating with other companies much more frequently to prevent roads from being dug up multiple times , which led to fewer roadworks overall .

documents.title: breakingftse higher
text: the ftse 100 has opened 0.6 % higher at 7,278 points .

documents.title: renault 's record results
text: french carmaker renault posted record sales and profits last year , with operating profit surging 17.4 % to a better than expected €3.85bn on revenues of €59.25bn .

the strong financial performance may help chief executive carlos ghosn to resist pressure from the french government , renault 's biggest shareholder , for a closer tie-up with nissan that safeguards national interests .
mr ghosn has also agreed to cut his salary by about 30 % , renault confirmed , securing government support for his reduced package .

last month renault said global vehicle deliveries rose 8.5 % in 2017 , with about a third of the growth coming from europe , helped by its new koleos mid-sized suv and recently revamped megane range .

documents.title: australian winemaker chases copycats
text: one of the world 's biggest listed winemakers , treasury wine estates , is taking legal action against `` copycat operators '' in australia and china .
treasury says a firm called rush rich has infringed the penfolds brand , including the unauthorised use of its ben fu trade mark - the chinese transliteration for penfolds .
we have become aware of a number of copycat operators that are taking illegal and unfair advantage of the success of iconic brands such as penfolds , '' says chief executive michael clarke .
treasury said it was especially concerned with copycat wine believed to have been bottled by third-party operators in south australia .
to protect the long-term success of australia 's global wine trade , it was critical for producers , authorities and the government to take action , mr clarke adds .

documents.title: balfour 's off to lax
text: balfour beatty is part of a consortium that has won a near- $ 2bn contract to build a 2.25-mile above-ground airport transport system at los angeles international airport .
it marks balfour 's `` first major public-private partnership in the us civil infrastructure market '' , the company said .
chief executive leo quinn said : `` this award at lax , one of the world 's busiest airports , recognises our expertise and track record for delivering critical transportation infrastructure . ''

documents.title: 'partial ' customs union ?
text: uk companies are becoming increasingly concerned about post-brexit trade , prompting the institute of directors ( iod ) to propose a partial customs union .
it will cover industrial goods and processed agricultural products to ensure that the uk remains competitive in certain industries .
such a model would also enable the government to have an independent trade policy with tariffs on agricultural products from developing nations , such as sugar , oranges and beef .

`` we think that something that is based on what turkey has and building up from there would work , because you can have effective control over the agricultural tariffs but you keep the integrated supply chains in industrial goods with the eu , '' allie renison , the iod 's head of europe and trade policy , tells today .
`` it 's a compromise solution .

you do n't remove every single constraint on your trade policy - you still have the ability to do a lot of your own trade agreements , but you make a compromise in the sense that you allow companies to minimise the costs of brexit . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: investor fears are falling
text: last week , the main us stock indexes suffered their first correction in two years .
the vix volatility index surged , but it began to sink back to below its long-term average this week .
so are us markets recovering ?

`` the vix index which shot up from 10 to nearly 50 is now back down about halfway , so as far as the fear gauge is concerned , markets have regained their footing , and although we 're still seeing bond yields rising , the stock market seems to be rising as well , '' lucy macdonald of allianz global tells today .
`` so that correlation is suggesting that the fears about inflation are not so much that they would curtail equities . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: 'mission impossible '
text: tom bourlet tells breakfast he pays £ 535 a month to rent a room in a flat in central brighton :
will young people ever be able to afford a home ?
new figures suggest the number of young people buying homes has collapsed .
tom for brighton tells us it 's just not manageable .
when i saved for a house did n't go out for 2 years .
now though , got to have latest phone , big tv , new playstation & designer clothes .
you have to learn to go without .
two whole years ?
wow .
out of interest , when was that ?
in 1990 , the avg uk house price was about £ 55k , the avg wage was £ 13,760 .
if you somehow put every penny into buying a house , you could buy it outright in about 4 years .
avg rent was £ 200 per month , 1.4 % of salary .
2/3 compare that to 2017- avg uk house price is £ 226,756 , avg wage is £ 27,600 .

saving every penny , you 'd take 8.2 years to get the same property , except rent is now 27 % of salary ( 49 % london ) , so it 'd actually take 11 years doing nothing but working & paying rent to buy outright
3/3 we 're buying property in a different environment to you , and `` not going out for two years '' is n't going to make a blind bit of difference to whether we can afford a house or not .
please do your research before you generalise a generation next time .
they expect to spend their money on iphones homidays and cars .
etc etc etc .
then complain `` i cant afforx to buy a house '' .
years ago peoples focus were happy to forefit 'nice to have ' so they could buy a house .
go on then , explain how millennials are responsible for the financial crash , the wage freeze and austerity - or do you just enjoy pouring bile on other people ?
actually the 'crash ' helped keep houses prices down
why do properties change so much in price terrace properies in liverpool range from £ 60000 in one area to £ 200000 within a few miles , same sized property
buy the £ 60k one and move from there instead of complaining the £ 200k one is out of reach .
it 's called the bottom rung of the ladder for a reason .
people need more realistic expectations .
could you find me a £ 60k house to live in london ?
no ? !
# ktnxbye
2 bed flat shared ownership £ 63k get your head out the clouds !
full market value - £ 255,000 my heads in the books not in the air .
buy to let is not the answer # readthesmallprint
it 's not a buy to let at all .
it 's shared ownership .
you buy a 25 % share then pay £ 500 per month rent .
seems a bargain for london .
house prices and deposit sizes are out of the reach for many .
this pushes houses into the hands of landlords , pushed up rental demand and raises rents .
this just is n't sustainable , especially since prices elsewhere are already rising faster than wages .
maybe of your trying to buy a 3 bed house in a posh neighbourhood but what 's wrong with starting with a small 2 bed help to buy scheme somewhere not as affluent and building from there .
there 's also cash isas for deposits .
not impossible i have 2 friends just done it .
too many people now renting out properties , which low income people could buy , shows like `` homes under the hammer '' to blame ? ?
? possibly
bring back social housing for those that work .
that was who it was initially for .
bring back secure tenancies and that allows people to take pride in knowing it 's a home for life .
stop landlords charging outrageous rents !
divided britain .
low house prices in the north , no jobs .
good jobs in the south , no houses .
someone having a go at me saying i 'm complaining about not living in £ 200000 property , i wasnt saying that , what i want is same size property to be same price all over the country .
you only have to look at the rising gap between pay growth and house price growth to understand how much more difficult it is today .
anyone who believes it 's not harder today has their head in the sand !
the percentage of monthly salaries taken up by mortgage payments now is huge

documents.title: 'absurd rules '
text: almost two-thirds of britons on a middle income aged 25 to 34 owned a home back in 1996 , but two decades later that figure had sunk to just 27 % , according to the institute for fiscal studies ( ifs ) .

`` it is harder for young adults to accumulate wealth in the two main ways we do that in this country , which is through housing and through pensions , '' andrew hood , senior research economist at ifs tells today .
to fix the problem , he says the government need to change how it taxes property , because the policies for helping first-time buyers are not working .

`` the way we tax housing is very damaging - stamp duty stops people from moving and older people from downsizing , and council tax under-taxes most valuable properties , because it 's based on absurd rules from 1991 . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: more passengers for air france-klm
text: air france-klm plans to offer more seats on routes to asia and latin america to meet rising demand , but is facing stiffer competition from high-speed trains in france .

the franco-dutch airline said operating profit rose 42 % to €1.48bn - slightly short of expectations - but it reported a net loss of €274m following a €1.4bn charge on a new pension deal for pilots and cabin crew .

chief financial officer frederic gagey said revenues in france had come under pressure from new high-speed train routes to bordeaux and that the group was closely watching the development of new low-cost players .

`` but it seems that launching low-cost long-haul flights without connecting services is challenging , '' he said , pointing to norwegian air shuttle , which yesterday reported a bigger than expected loss for the last quarter of 2017 .

documents.title: ghosn stays at the wheel
text: french car giant renault has asked carlos ghosn to stay on as chief executive for a further four years .
there had been some speculation that he would relinquish his role as head of the firm - a position he has held since 2005 .
shareholders will vote on mr ghosn 's re-appointment at a meeting in june .
if approved , he would also remain on as head of the japanese-french alliance between renault , nissan and mitsubishi .
read more here .

documents.title: allianz profits down
text: german insurer allianz said net profit fell 22 % in the fourth quarter after a us tax overhaul , a weak dollar , other one-off costs and natural disasters took their toll .
the profit of €1.427bn was short of expectations of €1.58bn .

documents.title: good morning !
text: it 's friday - you 've made it to the end of the week , and so have we .
main event today will be january retail sales figures at 930am , and london fashion week gets underway too .
that and much more besides - stay with us .
author: Chris Johnston
Business reporter, BBC News
